info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 3:41PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN UNION AND CENTRAL OUACHITA PARISHES THROUGH 430 PM CDT... At 341 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brownsville-Bawcom, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Monroe, Claiborne, West Monroe, Swartz, Brownsville-Bawcom, Brownsville-Bawcomville, Richwood, Sterlington, Drew, Fairbanks, Perryville, Loch Lomon, Spencer, Millhaven, Rocky Branch, Pine Grove, Guthrie, and Deshard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
